content: the edie hat is knitted with two strands of yarn and the whole hat is folded double for extra warmth and coziness during the winter months combining a strand of silk-mohair knitted together with a bulky weight brushed alpaca yarn makes the hat really soft and gives it a beautiful halo the edie hat is designed for everyday use and it quickly becomes the only hat you want to use as it is worked in bulky and fluffy yarn and big needles it knits up surprisingly fast the hat is started top down and after the crown shaping the hat is worked in stockinette stitch in the round then the middle part is worked in simple 1x1 ribbing after which the second side of the hat is worked in stockinette stitch and finished by shaping the other end with decreases size one size women s medium the length of the hat is easily adjustable to fit head circumference 53-58 5 cm / 21-23 inches length with folded brim 26 5 cm / 10 5 inches length with brim unfolded 35 cm / 13 75 inches total length before folding the hat double 70 cm / 27 5 inches yarn 210-230 m / 230-255 yards 2-3 skeins of sandnes garn borstet alpakka 96 % brushed alpaca 4 % nylon 110 m / 120 yards per 50 g shown in colorway 5043 or other bulky weight weight yarn and 210-230 m / 230-255 yards 1 skein of isager silk mohair 70% mohair 30% silk 212 m / 232 yards per 25 g shown in colorway 12 or other lace weight yarn needles 5 5 mm / us 9 circular needle with a cable of 40 cm / 16 for the first half of the main part 5 5 mm / us 9 dpns or circular needle for magic loop knitting for the top of the first half of the hat 5 0 mm / us 8 dpns or circular needle for magic loop knitting for the top of the second half of the hat 5 0 mm / us 8 circular needle with a cable of 40 cm / 16 for the second half of the main part gauge 14 sts and 23 rounds = 10 cm / 4 inches of stockinette stitch on the smaller needles in the round holding both yarns together after blocking slightly stretched 13 sts and 20 rounds = 10 cm / 4 inches of stockinette stitch on the larger needles in the round holding both yarns together after blocking slightly stretched always use the needle size that gives you the right gauge notions 6 stitch
